messages: a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:36): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: Try looking through for where the second column is an IP address
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:38): most of them no ?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:38): Most of them no
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:39): Enough in some datasets (though obviously not this one) for it to be a big enough issue for it to be ignored in most UAs
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:39): PLus the fact that
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:39): Content-Location = "Content-Location" ":"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:39): ( absoluteURI | relativeURI )
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:40): Yeah. What you want to do is see if the IP address actually matches the URI if you try and access it
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:41): You mean line of this type http://209.184.141.5/caldwellheight/|http://209.184.141.5/caldwellheight/Default.htm  ?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:41): Yeah
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:41): what's wrong with those?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:41): The first column is the URI accessed, the second is the content-location value
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:42): In that case? Nothing
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:42): yes understood
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:42): give me an example you consider bogus
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:42): http://www.infocad.gr|http://192.168.100.90/INDEX.htm
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:43): ok then ? what is wrong with it?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:43): Try accessing both of the URIs
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:43): you mean they might give you a different result ?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:44): Note the latter is a private network one, and thus makes no sense on the public web
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:44): yes seen that. So how many private networks in the full sample?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:45): Like I wonder how many are really wrong
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:45): because from eyesight it seems not that many
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:47): the example you gave for example is a frameset
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:47): with a <frame src="http://www.infocadgroup.com" no border=0 noresize>
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:49): ahah there is a pattern
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:49): http://web-sniffer.net/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fclacsec.lima.icao.int%2F&submit=Submit&http=1.1&gzip=yes&type=GET&uak=0
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (03:49): Title: View HTTP Request and Response Header (at web-sniffer.net)
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:49): another one of your list
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:49): and again a frameset <frameset framespacing="0" border="0" frameborder="0" cols="166,*">
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:49): both were MS Internet Server
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:50): Now you raised my curiosity
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:50): Also a fair number will be IIS, which by default (until 7.0 IIRC) always sent Content-Location, even if you couldn't really find it
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:50): to see which system mangles Content-Location
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:50): There are cases where Apache sends a bogus Content-Location too
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:50): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: did you compile these stats somewhere?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:50): That would be cool if you did to publish them
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:50): Somewhere. That's half my issue with this.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:51): Somewhere is the very important word. I don't know where.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:51): what is the other half of the issue?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:51): It's unfinished analysis
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:51): So ok. I consider Content-Location not broken then ;)
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:52): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: the list of IPs you collected came from somewhere specific ?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:52): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb: Coming from one server, or the list URIs you mean?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:52): Maybe I should try to convince Brian Wilson to get the MAMA 2, The Return of The Vengeance of The Anger Web, to look at these?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:53): the URIs list
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (03:53): was it from a specific sample
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (03:53): This is one of Philip's datasets from his crawling
